dict.acceptation: 为，为了；倾向于；关于；当作；

sent.orig: I haven't been to see her for a long time now. For one thing, she lives too far away; for another, I've been rather busy.
sent.trans: 我好久没有看她， 一来路太远，二来没工夫。

sent.orig: She wrote for fun for many years before starting to write seriously for a living.
sent.trans: 在她开始正正经经地为谋生而写作之前，许多年她以写作自娱。

sent.orig: Abraham Lincoln called on his people to fight for freedom for all—Negroes and Whites.
sent.trans: 亚伯拉罕·林肯号召他的人民为所有的人——黑人和白人的自由而战斗。

sent.orig: After writing for the theater for many years, he turned to the art of film.
sent.trans: 他从事戏剧写作多年之后，又开始搞电影艺术。

sent.orig: An advocate for John could make out a case for him on this score also.
sent.trans: 约翰的一位律师在这方面也能提出有利于他的理由。
